intro: Cynometra longifolia, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and yellowish-white flowers. The tree produces a fruit that resembles a small, elongated coconut, containing a hard-shelled seed. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antifungal effects. The tree is also valued for its ecological role in providing habitat and contributing to soil stability in its native ecosystems.
